metadata.title: CVE-2019-11675 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The groonga-httpd package 6.1.5-1 for Debian sets the /var/log/groonga ownership to the groonga account, which might let local users obtain root access because of unsafe interaction with logrotate. For example, an attacker can exploit a race condition to insert a symlink from /var/log/groonga/httpd to /etc/bash_completion.d. NOTE: this is an issue in the Debian packaging of the Groonga HTTP server.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

groonga - 9.0.1-2
groonga-bin - 9.0.1-2
groonga-examples - 9.0.1-2
groonga-httpd - 9.0.1-2
groonga-munin-plugins - 9.0.1-2
groonga-plugin-suggest - 9.0.1-2
groonga-server-common - 9.0.1-2
groonga-server-gqtp - 9.0.1-2
groonga-token-filter-stem - 9.0.1-2
groonga-tokenizer-mecab - 9.0.1-2
libgroonga0 - 9.0.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: groonga package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.1-2').
